decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By using cards like Entomb and Grief, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own powerful creatures for reanimation. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will and Daze for protection, as well as card draw and deck manipulation with Brainstorm and Ponder. Overall, the deck aims to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures to overwhelm and defeat the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play for a quick and powerful attack. It relies on cards like Reanimate, Entomb, and Animate Dead to efficiently bring creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to quickly reanimate high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is a control strategy focused on utilizing a high number of spells to control the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw effects to maintain card advantage and answer threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional card advantage and synergies with the deck's various permanents. Overall, the goal is to control the game until the player can establish a dominant position and secure victory.

This deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures into play using Show and Tell, Entomb, and Reanimate effects. By quickly getting key creatures like Archon of Cruelty, Griselbrand, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats. The use of combo pieces like Omniscience and Animate Dead further accelerates the deck's game plan, while also providing resilience and flexibility. With a mix of disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize, this deck aims to win through powerful combo plays and overwhelming board presence.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible creature token. It uses cards like Knight of the Reliquary, Elvish Reclaimer, Crop Rotation, and Sylvan Library to search for and manipulate these key pieces. It also includes disruption in the form of Swords to Plowshares, Wasteland, and Mox Diamond to slow down the opponent. The deck's main goal is to win through the Dark Depths combo while controlling the game with a versatile set of tools.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful artifacts like Chalice of the Void and The One Ring to disrupt your opponent's game plan while establishing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster. By locking down the opponent's spells with cards like Blood Moon and Trinisphere, you can overwhelm them with creatures and direct damage from cards like Fury and Shatterskull Smashing. With mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, this deck aims to control the game and win quickly through aggression and disruption.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck revolves around using the combo of Throes of Chaos and Tibalt's Trickery to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Apex Devastator. The deck also features ramp options such as City of Traitors and Crystal Vein to quickly generate mana for big plays. Creative Technique allows for additional versatility in searching for combo pieces. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly assembling its combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with massive threats to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate. This allows for fast and unexpected plays to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures on the battlefield. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. Additionally, there are options for card draw and deck manipulation with Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in executing the reanimation strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using cards like Stifle, Daze, and Dress Down to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage through Ponder, Brainstorm, and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent, Phyrexian Dreadnought, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to apply pressure and win the game. The mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and efficient combo using cards like Infernal Tutor, Duress, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating mana with cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond. The goal is to play Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game in a single turn by dealing lethal damage. Wishclaw Talisman and Burning Wish provide additional ways to find key combo pieces, creating a powerful storm deck that can win quickly and decisively. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble help with card advantage and flexibility.
